intro: Diosma joubertiana, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It has linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Diosma joubertiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
